info.description: The exploit that can be started strongly depends on the HW architecture of the node.
The first stage consists in having a legitimate access to the cloud service
A VM has to be started on the node on which data must be stolen.
The idea is to use exploit to progressively obtain information on data manipulated by users, typically using exploit such as Meltdown
Mostly by social engineering
Use CVE database to become aware of root attacks
By hijacking the OS vendor server for instance
This means opening the cloud node, and connecting to the RAM dimm. This may include to freeze the RAM.
Could be done by accessing to administrator's database
Enter into the correct building and alley
Use physical user threatening to obtain user crendentials
Use phishing techniques to steal user credential
Illegitimately get valid user credentials
This attack assumes that the OS can access to any data in RAM, i.e. no TEE is used or an exploit must be used to be able to access to the encryption keys of the TEE
This attack consists in stealing data directly from the RAM by getting a physical access.
Stealling user data, either input, running or output data. Targetted data are typically industrial information, crypto material, and credentials.
This includes shutting down the power, and changing its configuration so that computing nodes start crashing
Using social engineering or exploit
Find how the power source is obtained, and figure out if power source is controlled by IT
By knowing the remote Os and re-using or developing remote login exploit code
typically, by social engineering
the attack consists in blocking the administrative console by installing a malware application that unblocks only once the user has paid a ransom.
traffic should be generated in a smartway so that generated nodes are not blacklisted
The DDoS could rely on the use of botnets
Find the Internet adresses related to the cloud service
By flooding the access network to the different cloud centers
Make the cloud non functional, leading to financial loss
From the host OS access, start VM
Use VM escaping exploits to log into the host OS
This attacks consists in executing a legit VM. From this VM, the attack consists in escaping the VM to get information on OS, and then to use exploit to start other VMs for free.
blah blah blah
Use physical user threatening to obtain user crendentials
Use phishing techniques to steal user credential
Illegitimately get valid user credentials
Ideally, the botnet should be used in an undetected way
Use any techniques (phishing, exploit etc.) to get user credentials for free.
Regularly buy a user account
The attack consists in starting a remotely-controlled botnet.
The attack consists in using a cloud service to conduct other remote attacks (DDoS, phishing campaign, etc.)
